availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Delaney (Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Mathias Delaney and Maria M. Delaney. Resident of Lincoln County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Lincoln County in 1860. Served in the 19th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from January 2, 1862, to October 15, 1863. Served in the Veteran Reserve Corps (U.S.A.) from April 10, 1864, to January 2, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, District 2, p. 313A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Stanford, p. 33.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0321.
Historical Register of National Homes for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers, 1866-1938, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series M1749, 282 Rolls, Danville Branch, Danville, Illinois, p. 93/864 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "John M Delaney (1814-1911)," Memorial #95904995, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95904995 (accessed January 2, 2021).
